titles.title: Liveable Wage Act of 1995
To create a liveable wage by the year 2000.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities. subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

bill.summary: 2/1/1995--Introduced. Liveable Wage Act of 1995 - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage per hour to: (1) $4.60 in 1996; (2) $4.85 in 1997; (3) $5.00 in 1998; (4) $5.15 in 1999; and (5) $5.30 in 2000 and thereafter.
